author: Jaykul
body:
If we could leave out the commas between parameters when writing parameter definitions on multiple lines, then code _between_ the parenthesis in the parameter block could be valid PowerShell (if we assign default values).

I want to be able to write parameters like this (especially on my scripts, where we frequently hard-code the default values which we rarely if ever actually change):

```PowerShell
[CmdletBinding()]
param(
    [ValidateSet("apply","delete")]
    $command = "apply"
    $deployment = "DeploymentSetName"
    $ResourceGroup = "KubernetesResouceGroup"
    $ClusterName ="KubernetesCluster"
)
```

The point is, of course, that now I can select and run those parameter lines into a host when I'm trying to write the rest of the function and I need to test lines which use those parameters.
title: Make commas between parameters optional
